intro: Impatientella inaperta var. viridis, commonly known as the green impatient plant, is a rare and unusual species within the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its unique, flattened, leaf-like structures that resemble small, green leaves clustered around a central stem. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, adding a subtle ornamental appeal. It is native to specific regions in South America and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its rarity and distinctive morphology, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
